Topic.Name: Drawing Mode
Topic.Title: Drawing Mode
Topic.s:
Drawing mode is meant to draw new polygons in the current document.

To activate drawing mode, click the Drawing Mode button in the Drawing tool bar. To exit this mode and enable the Algorithm tool bar after you're done drawing new polygons, click the button again.

 

Drawing Polygons

After enabling Drawing mode just click on a point on the drawing area to start a new polygon at this point. Move your mouse cursor and you'll see a live preview of the current segment between the point you just set and you're current mouse cursor location.

To set the current cursor position as the next vertex, just left-click. If there are any intersection with other polygons or the polygon currently being drawn, the vertex will not be set and you'll be warned by a message in the log window.

To finish a polygon, right-click on the drawing area and and in the context menu select Close Polygon. Make sure there are no intersections with the closing segment, as the polygon cannot be closed in this point. Anyway, you'll again be informed by a message in the log window, if so.

To cancel a polygon currently drawn, again right-click on the drawing area and select the context menu entry Cancel Polygon.

 

Delete Polygons

Select a polygon by either clicking on it in the polygon list or on the drawing area (only if not in Drawing mode).

To actually delete the polygon, right-click on it in the polygon list and select one of the following context menu entries:

    • Delete polygon to delete the current polygon but keep the polygons inside it.
    • Delete polygon and all child polygons to delete the current polygon and all polygons inside it.
